alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 6:43PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Cheyenne and south central Kit Carson Counties in east central Colorado through 715 PM MDT... At 643 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 17 miles south of Seibert, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Cheyenne and south central Kit Carson Counties in east central Colorado. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for east central Colorado.
